content:
Good morning! I've started venturing into co/algebraic modal logic and I'm noticing that basically everything is done in a Kleisli category, as in: everything described in Venema's "Algebras and Coalgebras" so far can be described as some endofunctor in a category of free algebras over some set-valued monad (Also took part in ItaCa this winter and the term "Kleisli Category" was thrown around multiple times so I guess it must be quite important for categorial logic in general). Are there any resources you can recommend to learn more about monads comonads and their free co/algebras? I'm sure that they must have nice properties and I'd like to have some resources to gain expertise

Thanks in advance

@Dan Marsden posted a long series of blog posts (starting here) on monads, and he usually listed additional references on the different aspects covered. I do not remember there being much material on comonads in this series.
Thanks! I'll check it out right now
